thread.title: France says June is 'ultimate deadline' for Brexit progress on Northern Ireland

title: France says June is 'ultimate deadline' for Brexit progress on Northern Ireland
text:
May 13, 2018 / 7:52 PM / a few seconds ago France says June is 'ultimate deadline' for Brexit progress on Northern Ireland
DUBLIN (Reuters) - A June summit of European Union leaders is the “ultimate deadline” to make progress on issues related to Northern Ireland’s border, French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said on Sunday. French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian speaks during a meeting in Cairo, Egypt April 29, 2018. REUTERS/Mohamed Abd El Ghany
“The June deadline is the deadline that must be seen as the ultimate deadline” to find a way to avoid a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland and allow progress in Brexit talks, Le Drian told reporters in Dublin.
Britain’s Brexit minister David Davis in April told a British parliamentary committee that June was an “artificial deadline” on the issue. Reporting by Conor Humphries; Editing by Angus MacSwan
